AccUlist

AccUlist, a simply-designed and user-friendly website, is about to revolutionize consumer-practice of small retailers. This groundbreaking platform enhances the concept of review sites by adding a real-time social media element to give consumers immediate and up-to-date information regarding their favorite local business. Upon leaving a business, a user fills out a brief form which will indicate whether popular items are currently in stock. If a business has not yet been recorded, a user can add a new business with the click of a button and then fill out a review. There are no user profiles or locators associated with AccUlist so all reviews are anonymous. Reviews not only indicate whether a location’s most popular items are in stock but they also include a comment section for users to add relevant information such as best times to shop. These reviews take seconds to fill out and seconds to upload to the website. Thus, people will easily become accustomed to adding reviews as it will add no hassle to their shopping experience. AccUlist’s best quality is that all its reviews are fresh and recent. In fact, all businesses’ reviews are reset each morning to ensure that a consumer is receiving only current and relevant information. Before heading out, a consumer can quickly check the day’s reviews to ensure that his or her favorite item will be there when he or she arrives. This website saves time and frustration and will encourage small businesses to keep popular items in stock. We look forward to widespread adoption of our website.

MyMisheberach

Hey everyone! Welcome to My Misheberach, a unique database that is helping Jews connect and help each other out. With My Misheberach, anyone can submit a name - English or Hebrew - of a friend or family member in need of a recovery from illness, a parnasah, a shidduch, etc. The app is unique in that it will email participants with however many names they would like to pray for, and it will remind the people who submit the names to keep their condition updated. We almost ran out of time but thanks mainly to James we were able to pull through. Really hoping this app becomes a big help to the Jewish people. We hope to add a special section with educational materials on prayer in the future.

meetyu

My submission for the Reinvent:YU May 2016 hackathon, along with Michael Alpert and Chaviva Freedman.

An app where YU students can find out what there is to do without having to deal with all the YStuds. If you want to set up an event, you have to clear it with Student Life before the email goes out; now, you can make events here and cut out the middleman!

You can create events and give them a time, place, and amount of people you're looking for. Other people can see what events are happening, and decide to join ones they're interested in.

Future development could add features like adding a central database (the guy with the server had to leave) to support multiple users simultaneously, searching for events by type, time, or place, and having user accounts to log in and keep track of what events a user plans to attend.

Shabbat Shluf

Do you ever find yourself up high in an apartment and cannot see the weather? Well I do! You set the time for the alarm before Shabbat and at the appointed time, you will be woken up at the set time. No need to press any buttons and break the laws of Shabbat.

With a clean and simple user interface the app will be a useful tool to enhance your Shabbat.
